intro: Polygala hebecarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Polygala hebecarpa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native environment.
